alert.note: Alert for Cheyenne County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 05 at 5:21PM MDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Cheyenne County in east central Colorado through 545 PM MDT... At 521 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles west of Weskan, or 12 miles east of Cheyenne Wells, moving south at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southeastern Cheyenne County in east central Colorado, including the following locations... Arapahoe. This includes Highway 385 between mile markers 138 and 140. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM MDT for east central Colorado...and west central Kansas.
